snippet: The Dow and the S.& P. 500 closed out their fifth consecutive week of gains, led once again by expectations for global central bank stimulus despite discouraging signs for worldwide growth.
abstract: Stocks on Wall Street end mostly higher as the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index ran its streak of daily gains to six sessions, but activity was light as the market slogged through the start of a seasonally slow period.
lead_paragraph: The Dow and the S.& P. 500 closed out their fifth consecutive week of gains, led once again by expectations for global central bank stimulus despite discouraging signs for worldwide growth.

headline.seo: Stocks End Light Trading Day for a 5th Week of Gains on Wall St.
headline.main: Stocks Climb Back After Early Losses
headline.print_headline: A Light Day of Trading Caps a 5th Straight Week of Gains for Wall Street
